Title_Description:
Setting refs in Form children not compatible with React.createRef() - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.4.1

### Environment
Linux, Chrome 65

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/fibbers/pen/XEGojx](https://codepen.io/fibbers/pen/XEGojx)

### Steps to reproduce
When using React 16.3's [`React.createRef`](https://reactjs.org/docs/refs-and-the-dom.html#creating-refs) and passing this to an `Input` _inside a `Form`_, the `ref` is parsed as either a `String` or a `function`.
However, `React.createRef` creates an object. This causes an error (see the browser-console in the Codepen).

### What is expected?
No error, just using the passed `ref`

### What is actually happening?
The error isn't thrown when using an `Input` outside of a `Form`, see https://codepen.io/fibbers/pen/KoEGoO.

---
It seems the error is caused by rc-form's [`createBaseForm`](https://github.com/react-component/form/blob/183d2b40e025cac1d61cf42fe3e18af7227f7248/src/createBaseForm.js#L334), however I wasn't able to reproduce it with just rc-form.

Title_Description:
Select crashes after option list is updated - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.6.1

### Environment
react v16.2.0

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/9z8x14l43w)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click to check "Foo" checkbox. This should update Option list to be "Foo1" and "Foo2".
2. Select "Foo1" in select menu;
3. Unselect "Foo1" in select menu;
4. Uncheck "Foo" checkbox.
5. Check "Bar" Checkbox. This should update Option list to be "Bar1" and "Bar2"
6. Check Select input to show dropdown menu

### What is expected?
The dropdown menu is shown.

### What is actually happening?
It crashes with below error:
Invariant Violation
Unable to find node on an unmounted component.

---
This is reproduced against React v16.2.0, but not in v16.4.0.

Title_Description:
Popover doesn't work correctly with Tooltip - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.6.1

### Environment
chrome, windows 10, react 16

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/qxyx911pv4)

### Steps to reproduce
  - create Button inside Tooltip inside Popover.
  - hover button
  - tooltip appears, button receives class ant-tooltip-open
  - click button
  - popover appears, BUT button doesn't receive class ant-popover-open

if you switch tooltip and popover hierarchy, then  ant-tooltip-open will be blocked.

FYI: Inner component Trigger doesn't pass className to the child.

### What is expected?
Expected that trigger component (e.g. button) receive classes from both (all) triggering component(popover and tooltip) over it.

### What is actually happening?
only nearest triggering component passes class to trigger

Title_Description:
Avatar text not centered inside of Popover when using "visible" prop - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.6.2

### Environment
Windows 10, Google Chrome Version 67.0.3396.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/1yvjrvmr73)

### Steps to reproduce
See sandbox link to minimal reproduction. Try to hover over the button multiple times. Only the first time text inside of an Avatar will be centered correctly.
Problem is with using visible={this.state.popoverVisible}. If you remove that code, it will work properly. 

### What is expected?
Avatar contents should be centered no matter how many times user opens a Popover

### What is actually happening?
Avatar contents are centered only first time Popover opens, after that they are misplaced to the right.

---
To fix it in my project I added this code: 
 span.ant-avatar-string {
      position: static !important;
    }

Title_Description:
Form.Item validateStatus is "success" when shouldn't be with validateTrigger="onBlur" - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.7.1

### Environment
MacOS 10.13.1, Chrome 67, React 16

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/1qlqxr8lpq)

### Steps to reproduce
Type into inputs (first is `validateTrigger="onChange"`, second is `validateTrigger="onBlur"`)

### What is expected?
Input with `validateTrigger=="onBlur"` should not show any `validateStatus` or `validateStatus=="success"` until validations have run and there are no errors.

### What is actually happening?
Type into first field input. Input is validated and shown as "has-error" until it is valid email and goes to "has-success".

Type into second field input. Input is not validated but is still shown "has-success" even though no validations have run.

---
Possibly need second additional check in [FormItem.tsx#L183](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/blob/master/components/form/FormItem.tsx#L183) to to see if validations have run at all.

Title_Description:
form.getFieldValue method will create a new field in fieldMeta - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.7.1

### Environment
Mac, Chrome

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/50x3l7y59n)

### Steps to reproduce
1. click "Add field" button
2. new row will be created with no issue
3. click "Error Button" button, no impacts to the function since the "list" variable has been initialized as an Array correctly.
4. reload the page
5. this time click "Error Button" first.
6. a new field "list" will be added to fieldMeta
7. click "Add field" button
8. error occurred because  list is an 'object' instead of 'Array'

### What is expected?
form.getFieldValue will not create a new field in form

### What is actually happening?
form.getFieldValue method will create a new field in fieldMeta. This causes an issue when set an array value to the field later.

Title_Description:
Safari: call setState in 'onFocus' and 'onBlur' for RangePicker, lead to 'focus <-> blur'  infinite loop - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.8.4

### Environment
macos   safari

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/y3yrwj2pmv)

### Steps to reproduce
```javascript
<DatePicker.RangePicker
    onFocus={ev =>
        this.setState({})
    }
    onBlur={ev =>
        this.setState({})
    }
/>
```

### What is expected?
just trigger once focus or blur event.

### What is actually happening?
lead to infinite loop, the browser was dead

Title_Description:
Popconfirm - The icon is not aligned to horizon when placement= bottomLeft/bottom/bottomRight - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate. ### Version 3.9.1 ### Environment OSX/Chrome ### Reproduction link [https://ant.design/components/popconfirm-cn/](https://ant.design/components/popconfirm-cn/) ### Steps to reproduce ```
``` ### What is expected? The icon should be aligned to horizon with the title of Popconfirm. ### What is actually happening? But the icon has 10px gap. --- Because the parent DIV of popconfirm has 10px `margin-top`, when the popconfirm is placed to the bottom, so the `top` of the icon element should be assigned to `30px`

Title_Description:
<Option> 閻 key 閸欏倹鏆熼弮鐘虫櫏 - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.9.2

### Environment
macOS 10.13.4, Chrome 69

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/qz7o9wkm04)

### Steps to reproduce
antd 娴兼艾鐨 `<Option>` 閻 `value` 瑜版挻鍨 `key` 閺夈儰绱堕柅鎺旂舶 React閿涘奔绲鹃弰鐥嗛弬鍥ㄣ俔(https://ant.design/components/select-cn/#Option-props)娑撻幐鍥ㄦ戞禍鍡楀讲娴犮儴鍤滅规矮绠 `key` 閻ㄥ嫨鍌涚壌閹归柌宥囧箛闁剧偓甯存稉閻ㄥ嫪濞囬悽銊︽煙瀵蹇ョ礉瑜 `value` 娑撻懛瀛樻傞敍灞惧灉娴肩姴鍙嗛懛鐎规矮绠熼惃 `key` 閸楀瓨鐥呴張澶夋崲娴ｆ洘鏅ラ弸婊愮礉鏉╂ɑ妲告担璺ㄦ暏 `value` 瑜版挸浠涙禍 `key`閿涘矁绻栨导姘鑹板毀闁澶夎厬閻ㄥ嫭妞傞崐娆撴晩鐠囬妴

**鐠囬攱鏁為幇蹇ョ礉鏉╂瑥鎷板稿弶婀侀惃 https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/11909 鏉╂瑤閲 issue 楠炴湹绗夌瑰苯鍙忔稉閺嶅嚖绱濋柌宥囧箛闁剧偓甯撮惃鍕鍞閻浣疯厬閻 `value` 閸 <Option> 鐏炴洜銇氶惃鍕鍏兼Ц娑撳秴鎮撻惃**

### What is expected?
瑜版挻婀侀懛鐎规矮绠 `key` 閻ㄥ嫭妞傞崐娆欑礉娑撳秴绨茬拠銉ゅ▏閻 `value` 娴ｆ粈璐 `key`閿涘矁绻栨稊鐔告Ц閺傚洦銆傞幍鐏炴洜銇氶惃

### What is actually happening?
娑撳秶鈩冨絹娓氭稒鐥呴幓鎰绶 `key`閿涘矂鍏樻导姘濡 `value` 瑜版挸浠涙禍 `key`

Title_Description:
Form item error, should be shown first time on blur, not on change - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.10.0

### Environment
Google Chrome latest version

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/jxqyjy293)

### Steps to reproduce
type one letter in the field with 2 rules: "required" and "min"

### What is expected?
Error should not show when user is editing input, for the first time

### What is actually happening?
Error for "min" rule is shown when user edits form input

---
Expected behavior: 
User starts editing form input; 
Error is not shown; 
User blurs input; 
error is shown;
From then on, error is shown on onChange; 

I also know there is a validateTrigger which can be set to "onBlur", but it's not the case, it should only work once.

Please visit the link where it works properly with Formik plugin.
https://codesandbox.io/s/lp904qlj1q

Title_Description:
Providing array with value of an empty string breaks multiple/tags Select & TreeSelect components - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.10.3

### Environment
Mac OS 10.13.6 Chrome Version 70.0.3538.77

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/rynjwssl/pen/KGYQPZ?editors=1111](https://codepen.io/rynjwssl/pen/KGYQPZ?editors=1111)

### Steps to reproduce
You can either provide a defaultValue prop of `['']` or set the value prop to `['']`.

### What is expected?
The field should display an empty Select component or (preferably) show the placeholder message.

### What is actually happening?
Page-breaking error: "The above error occurred in the <Animate> component:
    in Animate (created by Select)
    in div (created by Select)
    in div (created by Select)
    in div (created by Select)
    in Trigger (created by SelectTrigger)
    in SelectTrigger (created by Select)
    in Select (created by LocaleReceiver)
    in LocaleReceiver (created by Select)
    in Select

Consider adding an error boundary to your tree to customize error handling behavior.
Visit https://fb.me/react-error-boundaries to learn more about error boundaries."

---
This was difficult to debug, because the error is from the rc-components package and provides no reference to where this is occurring in your app. The only way I was able to determine that this caused the error was by adding breakpoints in the rc-components library and looking at the props that were passed into their component.

Title_Description:
Some weird animation behaviour of Radio group and Switch occur in Popover - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.10.3

### Environment
"5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/69.0.3497.100 Safari/537.36"

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/n04pm6vz7m)

### Steps to reproduce
Click the radio button quickly. 

After that, you can see the animation will show on every button you just clicked including the switch component. 

If you wait few seconds to click the button, you may still see only one button show the animation you clicked before.

The Gif for this issue:
![antd-animation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18048923/47931236-2e57b600-df09-11e8-8442-4347b3524732.gif)

### What is expected?
Show the animation correctly .

### What is actually happening?
One click, every button show animation.

---
Using the radio group and switch together at the popover outside works fine.  

I have found if the handler of radio group contains the `this.setState()`, the animation problem will occur. 

Hope this clue will help you to fix it.

Title_Description:
Tabs arrow button is shown unintentionally sometimes - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.11.0

### Environment
mac os 10.13.1
node v10.8.0
antd v3.11.0
rc-tabs v9.5.6

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/9y66nk91o)

### Steps to reproduce
Refer to the codesandbox link.
Create a component with two tab panels and add following code to place tab bar at center position.
```
tabBarStyle={{ display: "flex", justifyContent: "center"}}
```
Switch between panels and observe the change.

### What is expected?
Tabs arrow buttons should be hidden.

### What is actually happening?
Tabs arrow buttons are displayed when switching between panels. And the arrow buttons do not function correctly as well.

---
This issue has been reported before but it still exists with latest version of  antd and rc-tabs.

https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/9767

https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/8861

According to the previous issues, the problem is related to calculation of container width. A temporarily solution is to set larger width in tabBarStyle

[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/m70qvk29p9)

### Steps to reproduce
1.姒х姵鐖ｉ悙鐟板煂鏉堟挸鍙嗗楀棴绱濋崚鐘绘珟1閿涘本瀵滈崶鐐舵簠

2.閻掕泛鎮楃拋鈺勭翻閸忋儲鍡楀帥婢跺崬骞撻悞锔惧仯閿涘苯鍟閻愮懓鍤閳ユ粍褰佹禍銈傛繐绱濋幋鏍鍛娲块幒銉у仯閸戠儵婊勫絹娴溿倐婵
    濮濄倖銉┿倕鍤閻滄壆娈戠紒鎾寸亯閿涙碍銈嗘傜悰銊ュ礋閹绘劒姘﹂崐鐓庢皑濞屸茬啊閿涘苯鎮撻弮鑸垫暈閹板繐鑲╂畱缁璇茬锋稊鐔峰綁閹存劒绨undefined娴滃棎

### What is expected?
娑撳秶鈩冨簼绠為幙宥勭稊閿涘苯褰х憰浣风村婵瀣绶閸忋儲鍡樻箒閸婄》绱濋崫閹鏇炲灩閹哄夌啊閸婄》绱濇稊鐔剁瑝閼宠棄鍤閻滅殟ndefined閿涘本宕查崣銉ㄧ樈鐠 閹瀹犱線鍣搁悳鐗堛儵1娑撻惃鍕绮ㄩ弸婊愮礉娑撳秵鍏傜憰2閻ㄥ嫮绮ㄩ弸婧

### What is actually happening?
鐎圭偤妾鏉堟挸鍙嗗楀棝绮鐠併倖婀侀崐纭风礉閻掕泛鎮楅幎濠傜厧鍨归幒澶涚礉閹绘劒姘︾悰銊ュ礋閿涘苯鐡у▓鐢垫祲閸忓啿鐓庤嫙娑撳秳绱伴幓鎰姘﹂敍灞芥礈娑撶皫ndefined缁璇茬烽獮鏈电瑝娴兼碍褰佹禍銈囩舶閹恒儱褰涢敍
鏉╂瑥姘ㄩ幇蹇撴嚄閻閻銊﹀煕閹鍏呮叏閺鐟拌偐娈戦弮璺烘瑱绱濇稉閻╂挳鍏橀弮鐘崇《娣囬弨鐧哥礄閺冪姵纭堕弨瑙勫灇缁屽搫纭风礆閿
閾忓熸潙婀鐞涖劌宕熼幓鎰姘﹂惃鍕妞傞崐娆庣瘍閼宠棄鍨介弬閺勯崥锔胯礋undefined閿涘奔绲鹃弰鏉╂瑤绠為崑姘鍔呯憴澶婄发娑撳秶鍩ラ敍灞藉倹鐏夋い鐢告桨閺堝婄发婢舵糿putNumber缂佸嫪娆㈤惃鍕鐦介敍灞煎敩閻浣稿弿閺勭棤f else閸掋倖鏌囨禍鍡绱濋搹鍊熺繝绡冮懗鐣屾暏闁宥呭坊閿涘苯鍟撴稉娑撶導f else閿涘奔绲剧亸杈ㄦЦ娑撳秶鍩ラ敍灞惧妳鐟欏夌瘍娑撳秶鎴濓箑鏅╅妴

Title_Description:
閺冦儲婀￠幒褌娆㈤崷銊ヨ剨濡楀棛绮嶆禒鏈佃厬娴兼艾鍤閻滄壆鈥樼拋銈嗗瘻闁介悙鐟板毊娑撳秴鍩岄惃鍕鍎忛崘 - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.11.6

### Environment
window7 chrome濞村繗鍫濇珤

### Reproduction link
[https://preview.pro.ant.design/list/basic-list](https://preview.pro.ant.design/list/basic-list)

### Steps to reproduce
1閵嗕焦濡稿ù蹇氬牆娅掓傛ê瀹崇拫鍐ㄧ毈濡鈩冨珯鐏忓繐鐫嗛獮鏇绱
2閵嗕胶鍋ｉ崙绫焗ttps://preview.pro.ant.design/list/basic-list](https://preview.pro.ant.design/list/basic-list)閹垫挸绱戞い鐢告桨閿涘瞼鍋ｉ崙濠氥夐棃娑撹箛鍐娈戝ǎ璇插為幐澶愭尦閿涘苯鑴婇崙鍝勮剨濡楀棴绱
3閵嗕礁婀瀵瑙勫棔鑵戦悙鐟板毊 瀵婵瀣妫╅張鐔 瀵鐟板毉閺冦儲婀￠柅澶嬪ㄧ紒鍕娆㈤敍宀勫夌存稉閺冦儲婀￠敍宀鍔ч崥搴ｂ樼拋銈嗗瘻闁界亸杈╁仯娑撳秴鍩屾禍鍡

### What is expected?
閸︺劌鑴婂楀棗鍞寸圭呯窛婢舵碍鍨ㄩ懓鍛鍨庢潏銊у芳鏉堝啫鐨閻ㄥ嫭鍎忛崘鍏哥瑓閸欐禒銉ユ躬瀵瑙勫棔鑵戞担璺ㄦ暏閺冦儲婀＄紒鍕娆

### What is actually happening?

Title_Description:
Disabled `Select.Option` can be selected in `tags` mode by typing the value and then can't be deselected - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/13kv4j8n5j)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click into the input. Note that the "f15" option is disabled and can't be selected by clicking on it.
1. Start typing "f15" (e.g. type just "f"). Note that the disabled "f15" option is no longer shown in the drop-down.
1. Finish typing "f15" and press `{enter}`. Note that the "f15" option is now selected and can't be deselected (either by pressing `{delete}` or by clicking on it in the drop-down).

### What is expected?
- The `Select` drop-down should show disabled options matching the search expression, not hide them.
- When the search expression matches exactly an existing disabled option, only that option should be visible and it shouldn't be selectable.

### What is actually happening?
- Disabled options are hidden on search.
- Disabled options can be selected by typing their exact value and pressing `{enter}` and can't be deselected.

Note that all of this is in `mode="tags"`.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.11.6 |
| React | 16.7.0 |
| System | MacOS Mojave (10.14.2) |
| Browser | Chrome 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit) |

### Steps to reproduce
Please refer to the link to minimal reproduction and open it with Chrome v71

Title_Description:
Using ShowAction to open dropdown on focus breaks click behavior - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/9l52v0j0rr)

### Steps to reproduce

1: Make sure you're not already focused on the `Select` component
2: Click the expand arrow (make sure you click the the down arrow icon.  If it doesn't happen, de-select component and try again)

### What is expected?
The select would expand and show the options

### What is actually happening?
It briefly opens and then immediately closes again.  
| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.12.1 |
| React | 16.7.0 |
| System | OSX |
| Browser | Chrome 71 |

---
Example is setup with a common use case of wanting the select to open when tabbed into.  It uses the underlying rc-select `showAction` which is mentioned in #6873.  You can see this in action by focusing on the input and then hitting tab.

However, adding this prop causes issues with the select opening up properly when clicking on it.

Title_Description:
Responsive menu not working with only one item collapsed - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
https://0o1m9x916l.codesandbox.io/

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open the link provided above or the ant design menu page (https://ant.design/components/menu/)
2. Open Chrome Developer tools by pressing F12 and change to mobile view (Ctrl   Shift   M)
3. On the device selector, choose responsive
4. Decrease (or increase) the responsive device width so that only the last item of the menu is collapsed in the dropdown item with the ellipsis icon (in antd page, the menu refers to the Top Navigation Example)
5. Press F5 so that we reproduce the environment of a mobile device with a menu containing only one item collapsed.
6. Click on ellipsis icon and try to click on "Navigation Four - Link"

### What is expected?
When clicking on "Navigation Four - Link" it is expected that we are redirected to the ant design home page, as specified in its code. 

### What is actually happening?
Nothing happens when we click on this item. What is strange is that the menu works perfectly when we have more than 1 item collapsed or the menu is fully expanded. 

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.14.0 |
| React | 16.8.3 |
| System | Ubuntu 18 |
| Browser | Chrome 7.0.3626.81 |

---
I ran into this bug while using the Ant Menu to develop a PWA. In Iphone 6 and Moto Z2 play, only one of my menu's item collapses and form a dropdown item with the ellipsis icon. I noted that the onClick event was not working for the collapsed item, which is weird since it was perfectly working on my computer screen. I also noted that in smaller devices on which more than 1 item is collapsed the menu works perfectly. I checked that the same bug occurs in ant design menu page when I use the responsive mobile device feature of Chrome.

Title_Description:
The argument file.status of Upload onRemove is always 'removed' - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/6zj7wn07k)

### Steps to reproduce
click the upload button, select a file, click ok, wait upload complete then delete the file and see the output of the console.

### What is expected?
error

### What is actually happening?
removed

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.13.6 |
| React | 16.8.3 |
| System | all |
| Browser | all |

---
Usually we clear the resource in the onRemove callback. for example request the server to delete the uploaded file (Which may be not exist because of upload error). So if `file.status` shows the last status, it will help us to decide what should do in the onRemove callback. On the other hand, only when `onRemove` return true, the status should become 'removed'.

Title_Description:
RangePicker does not support typing in start/end dates when in form - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://ant.design/components/form/](https://ant.design/components/form/)

### Steps to reproduce
### Working example (`DatePicker` outside form)
- View first example [in `DatePicker` documentation](https://ant.design/components/date-picker/) for `RangePicker`
- Click on "Start date" to open range picker dropdown
- Click on "Start date" text field at top of dropdown
- Type in a date, e.g. `2019-01-01`
- Observe the day being selected in the calendar as a start
- Click on "End date" at top (note click area is offset to the right, another bug has already been reported for this)
- Type in a later date, e.g. `2019-01-04`
- Observe the range Jan 1 to Jan 4 is selected, and clicking off the dropdown maintains this selection

### Broken example (`DatePicker` inside form)
- View seventh example [in `Form` documentation](https://ant.design/components/form/) including `RangePicker`
- Repeat the above steps to attempt to type in a start and end date
- Note that after setting the start date, it is selected in the calendar but the input is cleared
- Note that typing in an end date does not select it
- Note that clicking out of the dropdown results in an empty state with no value

### What is expected?
The `RangePicker` should behave the same when inside a form, allowing the start and end dates to be set by typing.

### What is actually happening?
When in a form, the RangePicker gets stuck in an empty state

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.15.2 |
| React | 16.5 |
| System | Mac OS |
| Browser | Chrome |

Title_Description:
expandRowByClick is getting ignored if onRow => onClick(...) present - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/2opjp3lnrp?fontsize=14)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add `expandRowByClick` prop to `<Table />` component.
2. Add `onRow` prop to `<Table />` component, inside the `onRow`, add `onClick` event listener.
3. If click on row, the `expender` **won't get expend**.
4. Remove `onRow` prop.
5. Click on row, the `expender` **will get expend**.

### What is expected?
Expect when both `expandRowByClick` and `onRow`(with `onClick` inside) props present, click on anywhere on row will still expand the expander.

### What is actually happening?
If both `expandRowByClick` and `onRow`(with `onClick` inside) props present, the `expandRowByClick` got ignored. Thus when you click anywhere on row, the expander won't expand.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.16.1 |
| React | React: 16.8.6 |
| System | MAC OS X: 10.14.3 |
| Browser | Google Chrome: 73.0.3683.86 |

---
The onClick listener is doing the logging stuff by calling some endPoint. expandRowByClick I assume is also using `onRow` prop (with `onClick` inside) internally.

Title_Description:
Drag stop (mouseup) on Overlay closes Modal - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://ant.design/components/modal/](https://ant.design/components/modal/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the "Open Modal" button of the first example. 
(The modal will open.)
2. Do a mouse down on the modal.
3. Drag the mouse cursor outside of the modal on the shadowed part of the screen.
4. Do a mouse up.
(The modal will close.)

### What is expected?
When the click start on the modal, the modal should not close when the mouse up occurs outside the modal.

### What is actually happening?
The modal close on mouse up outside the modal when the mouse down occurred on the modal.

| React | react Version 16.8.2 |
| System | macOS Mojave Version 10.14.3 |
| Browser | Chrome Version 73.0.3683.86 (Build officiel) (64 bits) |

Title_Description:
onSelect prop of Directory Tree does not work correctly - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/w66po35kzl)

### Steps to reproduce
**Please open reproduction link to see the behavior** \
Step 1. Open console to see logs of onSelect function. \
Step 2. Click a node named "leaf 0-1". Check that console shows that "selected" is true; "selectedNodes" is Array[1] \
Step 3. Click on that node again. \
Step 4. Click on that node again. \
Step 5. Continue clicking on that node again and again. \
 \
Step 6. Refresh the page to reproduce another related bug. \
Step 7. Open console to see logs of onSelect function. \
Step 8. Click node named "leaf 0-0". \
Step 9. Hold shift key and click node named "leaf 1-1". 

### What is expected?
Step 3:  "selected" must be true; "selectedNodes" must be Array[1].  "selected" is false only when do ctrl+click on that node \
Step 4:  "selected" must be true; "selectedNodes" must be Array[1]. \
Step 5: The "selected" must be true and "selectedNodes" must be Array[1] despite of multiple clicks on that node. Its value changes to false only when ctrl+click on that node \
Step 9: "selectedNodes" must be Array[5] corresponding to number of selected Keys. 

### What is actually happening?
Step 3: "selected" is false; "selectedNodes" is Array[0] \
Step 4: "selected" is false; "selectedNodes" is Array[0] \
Step 5: Behavior is always like step 4. \
Step 9: "selectedNodes" is Array[2] 

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.16.2 |
| React | 16.8.8 |
| System | Windows 10 |
| Browser | Google Chrome 73.0.3683.86 (64-bit) |

---
The original "Tree" component works correctly with expected behavior. However the "DirectoryTree" works differently like above description.

Title_Description:
Radio dot not in center on firefox - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

There were issues like this but all closed because you couldn't reproduce, or some other problem. 

### Reproduction link
[https://ant.design/components/radio/](https://ant.design/components/radio/)

### Steps to reproduce
No steps needed, just open link and look at radio button, when it's active the blue dot is not in center.

### What is expected?
![Chrome](https://i.imgur.com/iCymLWt.png)

### What is actually happening?
![Firefox](https://i.imgur.com/0chzfF0.png)

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.16.2 |
| React | Version used on https://ant.design/components/radio/ |
| System | Windows 10 Pro 1809 |
| Browser | Firefox 66.0.2 (64-bit) and Firefox developer edition 67.0b9 (64-bit) |
| Resolution | 1920x1080 |
| Browser scaling | 100% |
| Windows font scaling | 100% |
---
If we remove border roundness the difference becomes very clear:
![Firefox vs Chrome](https://i.imgur.com/CPvJm1n.png)
I have attempted to fix this by increasing css scaling function to .876 instead of .875, it becomes centered but also it becomes thicker on both firefox and chrome:
![Firefox vs Chrome with .876 scaling](https://i.imgur.com/Lr7qOTx.png)
And without border roundness for clearer difference:
![Firefox vs Chrome with .876 scaling and no round borders](https://i.imgur.com/XbRcWQX.png)

It gets centered with .876 but it becomes thicker, ideally we need a solution without changing css scale. It could work with scaling if you can make the outer pixel border half transparent like in chrome, but I'm sure there is a more elegant solution.

### Steps to reproduce
1.閹垫挸绱戦柌宥囧箛闁剧偓甯,鏉╂瑦妲哥规ɑ鏌熼惃鍓坧load缂佸嫪娆㈤惃鍕绶ョ; 閹跺﹦48鐞涘奔鍞閻,閼虫垝绗傛导鐘垫畱閺堟径褎鏋冩禒鑸垫殶闁插繑鏁兼径褌绔撮悙,濮ｆ柨鍌涙暭娑8,閻掕泛鎮楅崷銊┿夐棃娑撳﹥绁寸拠鏇氱瑐娴肩姵鏋冩禒鍓佹畱閸旂喕鍏

Title_Description:
`rowSelection.columnWidth` is not respected - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/r0vpl302yp)

### Steps to reproduce
Create a table that has a row selection column with custom width (<Table rowSelection={{ columnWidth: 40, ... }} ... />).

### What is expected?
The width of the row selection column should be `40px`, as specified by `rowSelection.columnWidth`.

### What is actually happening?
The width of the column is the default `60px`, not the specified custom width.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.16.3 |
| React | 16.9.0 |
| System | MacOS 10.14.4 (18E226) |
| Browser | Chrome 73.0.3683.103 (Official Build) (64-bit) |

---
Please note that `rowSelection.columnWidth` should be applied even when the row selection column is fixed.

Title_Description:
Connected Line of Nested Horizontal Steps Added as React-Node Description Inside Vertical Step Not Showing - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://94q9l4jvyo.codesandbox.io/)

### Steps to reproduce
```
const Step = Steps.Step

render() {

  const childHorSteps = () => (
    <Stepscurrent={1}>
      <Step title="A" />
      <Step title="B" />
    </Steps>
  )
  
  return (
    <Steps direction="vertical" current={1}>
      <Step description="Hello world" />
      <Step description={childHorSteps()} />
    </Steps>
  )
} 
```

### What is expected?
A connected horizontal line appearing between child (nested) steps inside vertical steps

### What is actually happening?
That horizontal line is not appearing.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.16.1 |
| React | react 16.8.6 |
| System | Windows 10 Home, Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-4200M CPU @ 2.50GHz    2.50GHz, RAM: 8.00 GB, System Type: x64-based processor |
| Browser | Google Chrome v73.0.3683.103 (Official Build) (64-bit) |

---
On debugging a separate horizontal `Steps` component, it seems like the line is a `::after` pseudo-element of the `Step` component's `title` which doesn't appear in this case. I tried on the latest ant-design v3.16.6 (previous current 3.16.1) but the issue still remains. My project nodejs dependencies: 
```
{
  "antd": "^3.16.1",
  "gatsby": "^2.3.32",
  "gatsby-plugin-antd": "^2.0.2",
  "react": "^16.8.6",
  "react-dom": "^16.8.6"
}
```

### What is expected?
Menu should remain open when submenu item not matching the specified key is clicked.

### What is actually happening?
Submenu and menu are closing

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.16.6 |
| React | 16.8.6 |
| System | Windows 10 |
| Browser | Chrome 72.0.3626.121 |

---
It would be nice to be able to keep both the menu and submenu open when clicking a submenu whose key doesn't match the logic specified for opening and closing.  There doesn't seem to be a way to keep the submenu visible after clicking.

Title_Description:
Notification with custom Icon has displaced title & smaller icon - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/k9l53oy86o)

### Steps to reproduce
Add `icon: <Icon type="smile" />` property to notification.success() call.

### What is expected?
Title is in same position as with non-custom icon. 
Icon is the same size as non-custom icon.

### What is actually happening?
Title is displaced.
Icon is too small.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.17.0 |
| React | 16.8.6 |
| System | Deepin 15.9.3 |
| Browser | Chromium 66.0.3359.181 |

---
It happens because the element with class `anticon` is missing the class `ant-notification-notice-icon` and thus does not match the rule:
```css
.anticon.ant-notification-notice-icon {
    position: absolute;
}
```
Probably best to adapt the CSS rule matcher to e.g. only `.ant-notification-notice-icon` - fixes both issues.

Creator: tennox

Title_Description:
Awkward navigation of AutoComplete when `defaultActiveFirstOption=false` and no values are selected - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/1q4j8jzx7j)

### Steps to reproduce
Route 1):

* Enter "foo" into the `AutoComplete` bar
* Press enter without selecting the matching "foo" option in the dropdown

Route 2):

* Enter "apple" into the `AutoComplete` bar
* Press enter without selecting any options in the dropdown

### What is expected?
The outer form should be submitted, thereby alerting "submit" to the browser in the demo.

My rationale: Even though no options are selected in the dropdown, if the user enters some text and hits enter, s/he should expect `AutoComplete` to actually use the value and proceed to submit the form.

### What is actually happening?
Nothing happens since no option is selected.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.18.1 |
| React | 16.8.6 |
| System | Windows |
| Browser | Chrome |

---
This glitch only occurs when `defaultActiveFirstOption={false}` because otherwise the first match always gets selected by default. Current workaround is for user to press `Esc` after entering the keyword and then press `Enter`, but I don't think that's ideal...

Title_Description:
When filtering <Select> options, the labels replace with the values - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-ne822)

### Steps to reproduce
- Create a multiple select
- Pass in default values
- Pass available options
- Turn on labelInValue mode
- Filter out already selected items

(see the code pen, better described there) https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-ne822

### What is expected?
Even if the item is filtered from the options, it should still show the label within the selected items

### What is actually happening?
The label for the selected value gets hidden, and the key displays, e.g. if you had `label: hello, key: world` then `world` would show instead of `hello`

Title_Description:
The onBack button on PageHeader component displays a pointer that is not always clickable - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://ant.design/components/page-header/](https://ant.design/components/page-header/)

### Steps to reproduce
The first example from the documentation is enough to showcase the issue.
1. Approach your mouse pointer to the left-arrow
2. Put it between the left-arrow and the divider
3. The cursor will be a pointer but you can't click to go back unless you are precisely on top of the left-arrow (which acts as a button)

### What is expected?
The entire section where the cursor changes to a pointer should be clickable to go back. It is a bit misleading that the entire block (`ant-page-header-back` div) is not clickable.

### What is actually happening?
The button defined by the arrow-left icon is clickable but the entire `ant-page-header-back` div defines a `cursor: pointer`

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.19.3 |
| React | 16.8.6 |
| System | macOS 10.14.3 |
| Browser | Chrome 74.0.3729.169 |

Title_Description:
Statistic <Countdown> not escaping characters in square brackets - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/antd-reproduction-template-beg6t)

### Steps to reproduce
Format Countdown with escaped text containing moment tokens.

*Statistic.Countdown* documentation says:

format:	Format as moment

*moment* documentation says:

To escape characters in format strings, you can wrap the characters in square brackets.
moment().format('[today] dddd'); // 'today Sunday'

use format as 'D [Days]':

const deadline = Date.now()   1000 * 60 * 60 * 24 * 2   1000 * 30;

<Countdown value={deadline} format="D [Days]" />

### What is expected?
2 Days

### What is actually happening?
Countdown is considering D and s in Days as tokens, and replacing them with values:

2 [2ay15]

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.20.5 |
| React | react 16.8.6 |
| System | Centos  7 |
| Browser | Firefox 60.7.0esr |

Title_Description:
antd table filterdropdown visible changed with keyword always trigger pagination onChange -- antd鐞涖劍鐗稿ǎ璇插為崚妤佹偝缁便垹鐫橀幀褝绱濋悽銊﹀煕閸︺劍鎮崇槐panel鏉堟挸鍙嗛崗鎶芥暛鐎涙鎮楅崗鎶芥４瀵鍦鐛ユ导姘承曢崣鎴濆瀻妞ょ數娈憃nchange閸戣姤鏆 - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/antd-zidongonchange-p848y)

### Steps to reproduce
The reproduction demo was based on the official demo
[https://ant.design/components/table/#components-table-demo-custom-filter-panel](https://ant.design/components/table/#components-table-demo-custom-filter-panel) 
Check on the reproduction link, click on the search button on the right side of the searchable column header, write sth in the input element inside of the dropdown search panel, then click on the other area to close the dropdown search panel. 



### What is expected?
Expect not to trigger the onChange event of pagination. At least exposed an API for developers to stop this auto-trigger behavior.

### What is actually happening?
When you click the search button on the right side of the searchable column header, write sth in the input element inside of the dropdown search panel, then click on the other area to close the dropdown search panel. You'll find the onChange event of pagination was triggered.

Title_Description:
<Icon> component does not render custom SVG well & also mentioned props for custom icon component does not work - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-08w2u)

### Steps to reproduce
Please check the example of codesandbox.
Step1 - take a custom svg icon. 
Step2 - render it in antD <Icon> component prop. It renders.
Step3 - now use <Icon> component prop 'type'. The custom SVG does not render anymore.
Step4 - Use the prop 'fill' - this does not effect the color of rendered custom SVG
Step5 - Use the prop 'width'/'height' - this does not effect the width / height of rendered custom SVG

### What is expected?
> 'Type' prop does not override 'component' prop when used both in same time.
> The props be working & customizing the rendered custom Icons dynamically

### What is actually happening?
> Prop 'component' is not overriding prop 'type'
> The props are not replicating the effect to SVG. There is no changes in the rendered Icon.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.20.7 |
| React | 16.8.6 |
| System | MacOs Mojave |
| Browser | Chrome 75.0 |

---
As noticed in the code for <Icon> component in antD:-
> The innerNode is getting overridden by 'type' check
>  There is an 'i' element wrapping the actual SVG & the props are not propagating to actual SVG element.

Title_Description:
Inconsistent styling for contents inside different TabPane elements - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/antd-reproduction-70852)

### Steps to reproduce
* Render a [`Tabs`](//ant.design/components/tabs/) element of the `"card"` or `"editable-card"` type with at least two child [`TabPane`](//ant.design/components/tabs/#Tabs.TabPane)s, all of which have identical contents inside with a margin area  閳 `16px` on the top. For example,
```jsx
<Tabs type="card">
  <TabPane tab="Tab 1" key="1">
    <Empty image={Empty.PRESENTED_IMAGE_SIMPLE} />
  </TabPane>
  <TabPane tab="Tab 2" key="2">
    <Empty image={Empty.PRESENTED_IMAGE_SIMPLE} />
  </TabPane>
</Tabs>
```

### What is expected?
The presentation and styling of the contents inside each TabPane should be identical.

### What is actually happening?
The top bar of [`Tabs`](//ant.design/components/tabs/#Tabs.TabPane) in the rendered output will have a `margin-bottom` of `16px` because of the following CSS rule from [`components/style/themes/default.less`](/ant-design/ant-design/blob/adc1879048053817a16a9cd2f6e053f81bf4b92c/components/style/themes/default.less#L497):
```less
@tabs-bar-margin: 0 0 16px 0;
```
This margin appears to have no effect on contents of the first TabPane (presumably because of margin collapsing), whereas contents of other TabPanes are pushed down by `16px`.

To see for yourself, switch back and forth between the two [`TabPane`](//ant.design/components/tabs/#Tabs.TabPane)s in [this Sandbox](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-70852) 

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.21.1 |
| React | 16.8.6 |
| System | Fedroa 30 |
| Browser | Chromium Version 75.0.3770.100 |

---
This issue can be attributed to the presence/absence of margin collapsing. Purely stylistics changes should suffice to resolve the inconsistency. It shouldn't take long to come up with a fix, so I'd very much like to work on it and create a PR shortly.

Title_Description:
Regression: Unused moment.js is now included in bundle - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/embed/antd-reproduction-template-l7t2h)

### Steps to reproduce
- Build a trivial app with a single <Input> like https://codesandbox.io/embed/antd-reproduction-template-l7t2h
- Bundle with webpack treeshaking
- Verify that moment.js is not included in bundle

### What is expected?
A trivial webpack app that uses <Input> should not include moment.js in the bundle. In 3.20.7 and earlier, this was the case. 

### What is actually happening?
In 3.21.0 and newer, this simple app pulls in moment.js which bloats the bundle by about 40k even though it's unused. It looks like this was introduced by https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/pull/17816 which made ConfigProvider depend on LocaleProvider which depends on moment. I believe a fix would be to separate ConfigProvider and ConfigConsumer into separate files.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.23.5 |
| React | 16.10.1 |
| System | OSX 10.14.6 |
| Browser | Chrome 77.0.3865.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) |

---
This bundle size regression is blocking our ability to upgrade past 3.20.7.

Drawer body css offset is not reset when drawer is destroyed - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://ibb.co/dGbz96K](https://ibb.co/dGbz96K)

### Steps to reproduce
1. go to https://ant.design/components/button/
2. then go to https://ant.design/components/drawer/
3. open the drawer
4. go the the previous page via your browser history
5. open the DOM inspect and you will see the <body style="width: calc(100% - 15px)"> is not reset


### What is expected?
The drawer css body offset should not remain in the body when the drawer is not visible

### What is actually happening?
the body css "width: calc(100% - 15px)" will stay forever and destroy my app design

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.23.6 |
| React | 16 |
| System | MacOS |
| Browser | All |

---
To avoid overloading my render compute, I place a lot of drawers into "if" statements like: {this.state.drawerVisible && <Drawer...></Drawer}
When the drawer is not visible anymore, it's killed by the render and the hiding animation doesn't complete the css cleanup.

Title_Description:
Invalid colspan value in Description List for vertical layout - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/hvb3q (example of vertical layout from docs))

### Steps to reproduce
Inspect `colspan` attribute on elements that visually span over multiple columns.

### What is expected?
For *Status* element - `colspan="3"`
For *Usage time* element - `colspan="2"`

### What is actually happening?
For *Status* element - `colspan="5"`
For *Usage time* element - `colspan="3"`

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.26.2 |
| React | 16.12.0 |
| System | Mac OS Catalina |
| Browser | Chrome 79 |

---
Due to this bug it is impossible to create layouts like this:
```
[  ][  ][  ][  ]  // 4x single column
[      ][      ]  // 2x double column
```
In second row, the `colspan` attributes would be `colspan="3"` and `colspan="3"`, thus resulting in:
```
[  ][  ][  ][  ]
[          ][  ]
```

Title_Description:
Tree: disabled node is not counted for checked state of parent node - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-tree-checked-state-issue-sq7ny)

### Steps to reproduce
Just run the code.

### What is expected?
`a` is checked, and `x` is not checked.

### What is actually happening?
`a` is not checked, and `x` is checked.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.26.3 |
| React | 16 |
| System | any |
| Browser | any |

---
It's a changed behavior in antd 3. In antd 3 disabled tree nodes are not counted for checked states of their parents, and are not affected by checking/unchecking their parents either.

Disabled-ness of nodes should not affect parent node state, because whether a node is disabled reflects a restriction of the operation, while the checked state reflects the current state.

In this demo, it just looks illogical that a node is not checked while its only child is checked, and another node is checked while obviously its 1st child is not checked.

Title_Description:
npm 2 娑撴担璺ㄦ暏 antd 閸欓懗鎴掔窗闁鍥у煂閻ㄥ嫰妫舵０ ### 閸︾儤娅

妞ゅ湱娲伴懛闊閸ョ姳璐熼棁鐟曚礁鍚嬬 IE8 瀵鏇犳暏娴 React 0.14.x 閻ㄥ嫮澧楅張閿涘奔绲鹃弰閸欏牆绱╅悽銊ょ啊 antd 婢堆傜艾 1 閻ㄥ嫮澧楅張

閸︺劏绻栫粔宥呮簚閺呮稉瀣剁礉閸 npm2 娑撴导姘婀佸板牆姘鍥ㄩ惃鍕濮ら柨娆欑礉閹躲儵鏁婃稉宥呭毉閻滄澘婀閺嬪嫬缂撻悳婢у喛绱濋懓灞炬Ц妞ょ敻娼扮拋鍧楁６閺冭泛娆
### npm2 娑

妞ゅ湱娲伴懛闊閺堝夌贩鐠 `react 0.14.x`, 閼 `antd^1.1.0` 閻 devDependencies 鐎涙ê婀 react 0.15.0閿涘苯婀 2 閻ㄥ嫮骞嗘晶鍐х瑓 install 鐎瑰奔绠ｉ崥 react 0.15.0 娴兼艾婀 antd 閻 node_moduels閿涘本娓剁紒鍫ャ嶉惄閸︺劍鐎瀵よ櫣娈戦弮璺烘瑩銆嶉惄閸愬懍绱伴幍鎾冲瘶鏉╂稐琚辨稉 react 閻楀牊婀伴妴鍌濈箻閼板苯绱╅崣鎴炲Г闁挎瑣
### npm3 娑

Title_Description:
Wrong Notification Behavior if I use it in useEffect hook  - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/elastic-villani-95yd2)

### Steps to reproduce
1. 閸︺劎绮嶆禒鏈佃厬娴ｈ法鏁 react hooks 閻 useEffect (use in a component)
2. 闁姘崇箖瀵伴悳閼汇儱鍏卞▎陇鐨熼悽 notification.open(call it for a few times)閿涘苯鍙炬稉 btn 鐏炵偞褑鍤滅规矮绠(set custom btn property)
3. 缂佹垵鐣(bind) btn 閻愮懓鍤娴滃╂(click handle function)閿涘瞼鍋ｉ崙璇叉倵鐠嬪啰鏁(call) notification.close(key)

### What is expected?
1. 濮ｅ繋閲滈柅姘辩叀濡楀棛鏃遍崥鎴濆瀻鐢鍐跨礉娴滄帊绗夐柌宥呭綌 (show separately)
2. 濮ｅ繋閲滈懛鐎规矮绠熼幐澶愭尦闁鍊熷厴閻欑粩瀣鍙ч梻閸忚泛鐟扮安閻ㄥ嫰姘辩叀濡 (I can close each notification by custom button dependently)

### What is actually happening?
1. 閸忋劑鍎撮柅姘辩叀濡楀棗鐖㈤崷銊ょ寸挧 (show stacked together)
2. 闂勩倓绨￠張妞よ泛鐪伴幐澶愭尦閼宠棄鍙ч梻闁姘辩叀濡楀棗鏍电礉閸忔湹绮閹稿愭尦閻愮懓鍤濞屸剝婀佹禒璁崇秿閸欏秴绨 (I can only close the top notification, but not others)

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 3.26.4 |
| React | 16.12.0 |
| System | win10 |
| Browser | chrome 79 |

- 閺屻儴 `headerRender`娑 `value` 閺夈儲绨娴 `generateConfig.getNow()`

```
  const columns: ColumnProps<Tenant>[] = [

|---|---|

| React | 16.12.0 |
| System | Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS |
| Browser | Chrome 80 |

---

See #21178

Title_Description:
Select.Option className does not appear in rendered DOM I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-58312)

### Steps to reproduce
Given the following code the `className` provided to Option does not appear in the DOM (when inspected).
```
<Select placeholder="Select frame...">
        <Option value={"1"}>First menu</Option>
        <Option value={"2"}>Second menu</Option>
        <Option value={"3"} className="foo-bar" style={{background: "red"}}>Third menu</Option>
        <Option value={"4"}>Fourth menu</Option>
    </Select>
```
See also the reproduction.

### What is expected?
The class name should be rendered.

### What is actually happening?
No class name.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.0.0-rc.5 |
| React | 16.9.20 |
| System | Windows 10 |
| Browser | Chrome 80.0.3987.106 |

---
Notice also that `style` is not included either. It can be useful to add classes or direct styles to an option. Also `className` is documented on `Select.Option`, so it should be working.

One partial workaround is to insert a `div` and put `className` or `style` there, but then this style is also used when the option is selected (in the trigger button), which in my case is not desirable.

Title_Description:
dropdown doesn't render in expected position if it's rendered in a table and uses getPopupContainer - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/dropdown-getpopupcontainer-in-table-8yc4g)

### Steps to reproduce
1) Create an Ant Dropdown component using the bottomRight placement prop and the getPopupContainer prop to render the popup in a specified div (in the repro link, this is done in a simple container component called OverflowMenu)
2) Render the Dropdown in each row of a table

### What is expected?
All dropdowns in the table render with the bottom right placement (unless, maybe there isn't room in the browser viewport, if that's a feature of the Dropdown).

### What is actually happening?
Dropdowns in the last three rows of the table render above their trigger button instead of below it, even when there's plenty of room in the browser viewport below the table for the dropdown to render.

Most importantly, this does not happen if you remove the getPopupContainer prop on the dropdown. When that one prop is removed, all dropdowns in the table render according to the placement prop.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.0.0 |
| React | 16.13.0 |
| System | macOS 10.14.6 (18G3020) |
| Browser | Chrome, Firefox, Safari (any) |

---
I strongly prefer to use the getPopupContainer prop for Ant Dropdowns whenever possible because the default implementation of the Dropdown has accessibility issues with keyboard navigation, and using a popup container next to the triggering element improves that.

Nest a Form.Item inside another Form.Item and when you unmount (destroy) the root Form.Item React will throw an error: Warning: Can't perform a React state update on an unmounted component. ### What is expected?

### What is actually happening?
An error is thrown

Title_Description:
The value received by the onChange () event is different from the value displayed by <RangePicker/> - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/sweet-dew-4cznu)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Select any start time A (e.g. 2020/3/5 16:58:00)
2. Select the the end time B (e.g. 2020/3/5 01:00:00) which has same day as the start time, but less than the start time.
3.`<RangePicker/>` will automatically exchange the start time and end time, and the displayed time is [A, B].
4. The value received by the `onChange` event is wrong value [B, A]

## 闁插秶骞囧濄儵

1. 闁澶嬪ㄦ禒璁崇村婵瀣妞傞梻 A (娓氬:2020/3/5 16:58:00)
2. 闁澶嬪ㄩ崪灞界磻婵瀣妞傞梻鏉戞躬閸氬奔绔存径,娴ｅ棙妲哥亸蹇庣艾瀵婵瀣妞傞梻瀵告畱 缂佹挻娼閺冨爼妫 B(娓氬:2020/3/5 01:00:00) .
3. `<RangePicker/>`娴兼俺鍤滈崝銊ゆ唉閹广垹绱戞慨瀣妞傞梻鏉戞嫲缂佹挻娼閺冨爼妫,閺勫墽銇氶惃鍕妞傞梻瀛樻Ц[A,B].
4. `onChange` 娴滃╂㈤幒銉ュ綀閸掓壆娈戦崐鍏兼Ц闁挎瑨閻ㄥ垚B,A]


### What is expected?
- The value received by the onChange () event is same as the value displayed by `<RangePicker />`

- onChange()娴滃╂㈤幒銉ュ綀閻ㄥ嫬鐓庢嫲<RangePicker/>閺勫墽銇氶惃鍕绔撮弽

### What is actually happening?
- The value received by the onChange () event is different from the value displayed by `<RangePicker />`

- `<RangePicker/>` 閼烽崝銊ゆ唉閹广垹绱戞慨瀣妞傞梻鏉戞嫲缂佹挻娼閺冨爼妫块崥,onChange()娴滃╂㈤幒銉ュ綀閻ㄥ嫬鐓庢嫲`<RangePicker/>`閺勫墽銇氶惃鍕绗夋稉閺

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.0.1 |
| React | 16.13.0 |
| System | windows |
| Browser | Chrome@latest |

Title_Description:
[v4] Wrong styles when generating with less variables - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-v4-with-less-variables-reproduction-template-0mozw)

### Steps to reproduce
I use less css variables:
```lesscss
@font-size-base: 16px;
@border-radius-base: 4px;
```

Then I import components:
```
<Select mode="tags" />
```
```
<Button type="primary" size="small" icon={<PlusCircleOutlined />}>
  Some text
</Button>
```

### What is expected?
Normal Button with right padding, normal Select with right padding and margin (between tags) like with default less css build.

### What is actually happening?
Button component has wrong padding:
```css
.ant-btn-sm {
  padding: -1.6px 7px;
}
```

Select component has wrong padding:
```css
.ant-select-multiple .ant-select-selector {
  padding: -0.6px 2.4px
}
```
And space between tags (margin) is too small:
```css
.ant-select-multiple .ant-select-selection-item {
  margin-right: 2.4px;
}
```

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.0.1 |
| React | 16.13.0 |
| System | Linux |
| Browser | Google Chrome 80 |

---
There are also problems with negative padding in other places in the final CSS.

A prefix `ant-` is missing, for example:
```css
.ant-picker-input > input-sm {
  padding: -1.6px 7px;
}
```

Creator: Arttse

Title_Description:
Table column render method that returns a colSpan / rowSpan config object is not accepting data-* attributes - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/angry-rgb-2pce7)

### Steps to reproduce
Use render method in Column component (or a column object in columns array) that returns a config object as described in docs:
```
render: age => ({
        children: age,
        props: { "data-column": "Age", style: { color: "red" } }
      })
```

### What is expected?
<td> element should have `data-column="Age"` attribute in the html

### What is actually happening?
no `data-column` attribute present in html

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.0.2 |
| React | 16.12 |
| System | Mac OS Mojave |
| Browser | Latest Chrome |

---
This was working in 3.x version. This behavior is required for plenty of cases which custom data attributes are being used for. (different testid's, css attr() rules etc.)

Title_Description:
Updating empty text locale for table is broken since 4.0.3 - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/pmwmedia/antd-empty-text-issue](https://github.com/pmwmedia/antd-empty-text-issue)

### Steps to reproduce
Run `npm start` or `npm test` in linked GitHub repo

### What is expected?
The empty text for the table should change from "Empty Init" to "Empty Loaded" as it did in the previous Ant Design versions.

### What is actually happening?
The displayed empty text doesn't update after state change.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.0.3 |
| React | 16.13.1 |
| System | Windows 10 Pro Version 1903 |
| Browser | Chrome 80 |

---
It worked in Ant Design 4.0.0 - 4.0.2 and is broken since version 4.0.3. I can reproduce the issue on local Windows computers, but unfortunately not on codesandbox.io. Therefor, I have linked my minimal example project as GitHub repo.

Title_Description:
Slider with input field crashes when removing value from input field - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/pmwmedia/antd-slider-with-input-issue](https://github.com/pmwmedia/antd-slider-with-input-issue)
[https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-03hv0](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-03hv0)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Run `npm start`
2. Input any number in the input field after the slider
3. Remove the number again
4. Click somewhere on the page to remove focus from input field

### What is expected?
User could continue without any crash

### What is actually happening?
Web application crashes (TypeError: Cannot read property 'toString' of null) and user has to reload the page

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.0.3 |
| React | 16.13.1 |
| System | Windows 10 Pro Version 1903 |
| Browser | Chrome 80 |

---
Currently, I'm using a workaround with firing and consuming changes manually. However, it should be possible to use a slider together with an input in a form with `Form.useForm()`.

1. 闁姘崇箖HTTP閸旂姾娴囨潻婊呪柤閺佺増宓侀弮鏈靛▏閻銊ゅ敩閻浣藉墽鐤員able缂佸嫪娆㈤惃鍒瞣ading鐏炵偞
```
this.setState({ loading: {tip: "閸旂姾娴囬弫鐗堝祦..."} })
```
2. 閻愮懓鍤甌able缂佸嫪娆㈡稉閻ㄥ嫮鐐曟い鍨瀵滈柦閿涘碼ble缂佸嫪娆㈡稉宥呭毉閻滄澘濮炴潪鎴掕厬閻樿埖渚婄礉娑撴柧绗夐弰鍓с仛閳ユ粌濮炴潪鑺ユ殶閹...閳ユ繃褰佺粈鐑樻瀮鐎

```

```

Title_Description:
borderless prop not respected when used with Form.Item and it has validation errors - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-jeiq2)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add `<Input />` with a `<Select />` as the "prefix" to the `<Input />`.
2. Wrap the `<Input />` with a `<Form.Item>` component
3. Set the "bordered" prop to "false" for the `<Select />`
4. Notice how the `<Input />` still has borders as expected and the `<Select />` doesn't as expected
5. Set the "validationStatus" prop to either "error" or "warning"

### What is expected?
That the borderless Select, stayed borderless, even though there are validation errors.

### What is actually happening?
The styles from the <Form.Item /> that is overriding the border colors of its children is not respecting that the <Select /> is borderless thus adding a colored border to it. This looks a little silly when it's used as a prefix for the <Input />.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.1.0 |
| React | 16.13.1 |
| System | Windows 10 64-bit |
| Browser | Google Chrome Version 80.0.3987.149 (Official Build) (32-bit) |

Title_Description:
Form.List removing an item removes all subsequent errors - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://ant.design/components/form/#components-form-demo-dynamic-form-item](https://ant.design/components/form/#components-form-demo-dynamic-form-item)

### Steps to reproduce
I have tested with previous versions and it seems to have started to happen since `4.1.0`.

You can reproduce this by navigating to the dynamic form item documentation and:

1) Add several new fields in the form
2) Click submit to show errors on all fields
3) Delete the first field (as an example, but happens when deleting other fields)
4) All errors below the one deleted will disappear


### What is expected?
Errors that do not relate to the deleted row should remain.

The expected result is actually fine on a version below `4.1.0`.

### What is actually happening?
All subsequent errors are deleted when removing a field in a `Form.List`

Title_Description:
Popover and Popover arrow position, width and direction issues  inside a table  - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-jotce?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a table
2. Ensure have a column which has a link or a button which can show a pop over
3. Add a `ConfigProvider` to ensure popover scrolls with the rows
4. Toggle the `Ellipsis` prop for column and see how the pop over width and position is affected. The popover is actually getting rendered inside the column.
5. In some cases when there is not enough space to render pop over in its present direction, the direction changes but the popover arrow still points to the original direction not the new one
6. Toggle the `placement` prop for popover, if you don't add it we notice the popover width is correct. Adding it somehow limits the width and sometimes also changes the popover direction
7. Popover randomly changes direction showing a flick affect on screen. If first shows at one position and then switches quickly and shows at another making it appear like a glitch

### What is expected?
1. Playing with `ellipsis` prop in table or `placement` in popover, should not affected the popover so dramatically. 
2. Pop over arrow direction should show correctly in accordance with popover direction
3. Before rendering pop over, if it is determined that the space may not be enough and the popover has to instead show up in a new place, do not render it twice. It shows popover at one place and then flicking to another.
4. Pop over width should not change if placement prop is provided

### What is actually happening?
1. Playing with `ellipsis` prop in table or `placement` in popover, affects the popover. `Ellipsis` prop for table makes popover render inside the column, specially when it has a `ConfigProvider`
2. Pop over arrow direction changes randomly sometimes, if popover direction changes
3. When changes direction, pop over seems to render twice in some cases and so makes it appear like a glitch or flicker affect
4. Pop over should width change in some cases if placement prop is provided

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.2.2 |
| React | 16.13 |
| System | Mac OSX |
| Browser | Safari 13.1, Chrome 80.0 |

Title_Description:
Button hangs in loading state if loading prop is set back to false quicker than set 'delay' - [x ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-hogrp?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
In antd versions > 4.1.2 (including 4.3.0) if 'loading' prop of Button component is set to delay (e. g. { delay: 800}, not only to 'true') and loading finishes quicker than the delay set there, the button hangs in loading state forever. 

To reproduce use the provided minimal reproduction link. Click the 'Start loading' button and then click the 'Finish loading' button. - The Primary button was in 'loading' state correctly while "loading".
Now click the 'Start loading with delay' button and quickly after that click the 'Finish loading' button. Watch the Primary button as it hangs in 'loading' state forever. 

This bug was introduced in version 4.1.3 and is present in all antd versions after 4.1.2. This worked correctly in all versions before 4.1.3

### What is expected?
After loading finishes ('loading' prop of Button is set to false), Button stops being in 'loading' state (stops spinning the loading icon)

### What is actually happening?
Button hangs in 'loading' state with spinning 'loading icon' forever

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.3.0 |
| React | latest |
| System | Windows 10 |
| Browser | Chrome - latest; independent of browser |


<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Creator: alesn

After loading finishes ('loading' prop of Button is set to false), Button stops being in 'loading' state (stops spinning the loading icon)

Button hangs in 'loading' state with spinning 'loading icon' forever

Title_Description:
Form validateTrigger prop not working with onBlur - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/objective-heisenberg-j0tis)

### Steps to reproduce
* Set validateTrigger prop to "onBlur" on Form component
* Add Form.Item with Input to Form with required rule
* Focus on Input
* Blur from Input (no error)
* Focus on Input and type text
* Remove text
* Blur from Input (no error)

### What is expected?
Apply validation for all fields on the form when setting validateTrigger prop to "onBlur" on Form component instead of individually setting validateTrigger on each form item

### What is actually happening?
onBlur validation not triggering on form items when form-level validateTrigger is set to "onBlur". Instead, validation trigger is still only validating on change event.

Title_Description: No way to determine AM/PM when using disabledHours with use12Hours - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate. ### What problem does this feature solve? The prop disabledHours takes a function that returns an array of hours to be disabled. So if you want to disable all the hours before 6 P.M., you would provide an array of values from 1-18. However, when use12Hours = true, this will disable all the hour values (even when the user selects "PM") because it is apparently only checking the integers themselves and not their place on the 24-hour clock. In the example here, I'm trying to prevent the user from selecting an end time for their appointment that would be earlier than the start time, but that's impossible with the current API: ### What does the proposed API look like? When use12Hours=true, disabledHours should still accept an array of integers from 1-23, but it should be aware of whether AM or PM is selected in the overlay and adjust the disabling of values accordingly (so 1:00 PM should be disabled if "13" is provided).

Title_Description:
New Tabs (v4.3 ) bug with content width - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-tabs-6g83q?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
Create multiple Tabs with List components (that have some good amount of content) and then resize the browser so that contents start to wrap around. On the first render, the width of the List is responsive and works correctly. However, when switching between the tabs, the List components expand beyond the screen, which is undesirable.

**Note 1**: This is also happening with the Form component where input fields also expand beyond the screen.

**Note 2**: The bug does NOT occur in versions before 4.3.

### What is expected?
Tabs content width remains responsive when switching between tabs.

![bug_tabs_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22347954/84893082-933c3180-b096-11ea-8b30-41515c8643b2.png)

### What is actually happening?
Tabs content width extends beyond the screen when switching between tabs.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.3.4 |
| React | 16.13.1 |

Title_Description:
Clicking on suffix icon in Select component (w/ search field) should move focus to input field (but does not). - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-qhpuo?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the suffix icon (i.e., DownOutlined icon)

2. Notice that focus does not move to input field (and no blinking cursor prompt).

### What is expected?
Input field should receive focus when the icon is clicked (many users naturally click the icon to open the dropdown).

### What is actually happening?
Focus does not move to input field. Instead, you have to manually click in the input field in order to type/search. If you click anywhere within the component besides the icon, focus moves to the input field and the cursor prompt appears (as expected).

Title_Description:
Modal jumps out of screen - [ x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/modal-out-of-screen-6vv7l)

### Steps to reproduce
1.Create modal,
2.Add props: centered and width=1000 (should be more than 768)
3.Open modal and change browser width from > 1000 to <1000 and then <768


### What is expected?
Modal should remain in the middle of the screen

### What is actually happening?
when screen width becomes <1000 (defined modal width) it jumps down out of screen and scroll bar appears

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.4.1 |
| React | 16.12 |
| System | windows |
| Browser | chrome 83 |

---
- it happens also in version 3.*
- possible solution:
```less
.ant-modal-centered {
  white-space: nowrap; // prevent wrapping modal after :before element, that has screen height
  > .ant-modal {
    white-space: normal; // restore wrapping for internal elements
  }
}
```

Title_Description:
Menu with dark theme: selected item's background should have padding around content - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-byjl1?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
Use `Menu` component with `theme="dark"` and select one of the menu items. 

### What is expected?
The background color of the selected navigation item should extend to the left and right of the item's content. 

Before 4.5.0:
![Screen Shot 2020-07-27 at 12 47 04 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/974305/88588143-ebf2d880-d00b-11ea-9d9a-676fd14b9901.png)

### What is actually happening?
The background color ends abruptly to the left and right of the selected item's content. 

After 4.5.0:
![Screen Shot 2020-07-27 at 12 47 23 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/974305/88588172-fb722180-d00b-11ea-914c-ae6712483ac6.png)


| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.5.0 |
| React | 16.12.0 |
| System | any |
| Browser | any |

---
This is due to the following change: https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/pull/25622

With the `light` theme, the padding is not needed, because it makes sense for the underline to end where the text ends. But with the `dark` theme, it looks very unnatural without the padding.

Title_Description:
Modal styles are broken when using `Modal.useModal` hook - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate. ### Reproduction link [![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/restless-leaf-oste4) ### Steps to reproduce Use `modal` provided by `Modal.useModal` hook without `rootPrefixCls` and `prefixCls` set. ```js export default function App() { const [modal, contextHolder] = Modal.useModal(); return (
{contextHolder}
); } ``` ### What is expected? Default Ant styles are not supposed to be broken 棣冩 ### What is actually happening? Default Ant styles are not applied on the modal (and the modal buttons). | Environment | Info | |---|---| | antd | 4.5.0 | | React | 16.12.0 | | System | MacOS v10.15.5 | | Browser | Chrome v84.0.4147.89 | --- Seems to be related to this PR: https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/pull/25613 If `rootPrefixCls` and `prefixCls` are not set, modal class names look like this: `undefined-confirm-body-wrapper` on the DOM node. As a workaround, we can set `rootPrefixCls` to `ant` and `prefixCls` to `ant-modal`.

Title_Description:
table 缂佸嫪娆㈤悽銊ュ煂缁涙盯澶屾畱閺冭泛娆欑礉瑜版徎ilters閸欏倹鏆熼崐闂磋礋[]缁岀儤鏆熺紒鍕娈戦弮璺烘瑱绱濋幎銉ょ存径褍鐖㈢拃锕鎲 - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/sad-tu-dg6m7?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
{
    title: 'Name',
    dataIndex: 'name',
    filters: [],
    // specify the condition of filtering result
    // here is that finding the name started with `value`
    onFilter: (value, record) => record.name.indexOf(value) === 0,
  }
filters=[]閻ㄥ嫭妞傞崐娆庣存径褍鐖㈢拃锕鎲

### What is expected?
filter=[]濮濓絽鐖堕敍灞剧梾閺堝庯箑鎲

### What is actually happening?
React does not recognize the `inlineIndent` prop on a DOM element. If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom attribute, spell it as lowercase `inlineindent` instead. If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove it from the DOM element閵
React does not recognize the `renderMenuItem` prop on a DOM element. If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom attribute, spell it as lowercase `rendermenuitem` instead. If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove it from the DOM element閵
React does not recognize the `rootPrefixCls` prop on a DOM element. If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom attribute, spell it as lowercase `rootprefixcls` instead. If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove it from the DOM element閵
React does not recognize the `parentMenu` prop on a DOM element. If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom attribute, spell it as lowercase `parentmenu` instead. If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove it from the DOM element閵
React does not recognize the `manualRef` prop on a DOM element. If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom attribute, spell it as lowercase `manualref` instead. If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove it from the DOM element閵
React does not recognize the `eventKey` prop on a DOM element. If you intentionally want it to appear in the DOM as a custom attribute, spell it as lowercase `eventkey` instead. If you accidentally passed it from a parent component, remove it from the DOM element
...

濡閸氭垼褰嶉崡鏇＄Т閸戞椽鍎撮崚鍡涙ｉ挊蹇撳涢懗绱筓G閿涘本绻侀懝鑼姣婇懖銈堝厴閺勫墽銇氱紓鈺冩殣閸欏嚖绱濆ù鍛板婇惃閼层倖妫ゅ▔鏇熸▔缁铏圭級閻ｃ儱褰 - [ ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/pen/?&editable=true&editors=001=https%3A%2F%2Fant-design.gitee.io%2Fcomponents%2Fmenu-cn%2F](https://codepen.io/pen/?&editable=true&editors=001=https%3A%2F%2Fant-design.gitee.io%2Fcomponents%2Fmenu-cn%2F)

### Steps to reproduce

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open on mobile (or responsive mode on desktop)

| React | 16.13.1 |
