Title_Description:
Select Component Scrolling Entire Page iOS - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[https://ant.design/components/select/](https://ant.design/components/select/)

### Steps to reproduce
Visit the Ant Design select component page on an iOS device using Safari. Click the "multiple selection" component to open the dropdown and attempt to scroll through the list of options.

### What is expected?
I expect the list to be the only element that scrolls, so that I can view all the options available to select.

Title_Description:
AutoComplete breaking behavior when the options are scrolled over - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
https://codesandbox.io/s/jibenshiyong-antd4102-forked-7xj8s?file=/index.js

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click on the input box, you will see that apple corresponds to options 1, 2, 3, 4
2. Click on the "Pear" radio button. 
3. Click on the input box, you will see that pear corresponds to options 1 to 18.
4. Scroll over the options and leave the scrollbar somewhere in the middle
5. Click on the "Apple" radio button.
6. Click on the input box, you will see options 1-4, which is normal. 
7. Click on the "Pear" radio button.
8. Click on the input box. Now instead of seeing options 1-18, you see only a subset of the options, which is unexpected. 
9. Now start scrolling over the options, you get to see all options 1-18 again. 

### What is expected?
see "Steps to reproduce"

### What is actually happening?
see "Steps to reproduce"

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.9.4 |
| React | 16.14.0 |
| System | Mac OS |
| Browser | Chrome/Safari/Firefox |

---

There is react effect to set uid on each file if not provided

Title_Description:
modal.update() doesn't work when called immediately after opening the modal via hook - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/modalupdate-not-working-n5okh)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Call the hook to get a contextualized helper `const [modal] = Modal.useModal()`
2. Call a modal method, like modal.info() and save the returning instance `const m = modal.info({ title: "Original" })`
3. Immediately call the update method on the instance `m.update({ title: "Changed" })`


### What is expected?
I would expect the modal to have its title changed to "Changed"

### What is actually happening?
The title stays "Original"

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.12.3 |
| React | 16.14.0 |
| System | Window 10 |
| Browser | Chrome 88 |

---
I needed to trigger a context accessible modal, fetch some data and then conditionally update the modal content, which did not work due to this bug. The bug doesn't happen when you call `Modal.info()` directly instead of using the hook. Also, if you delay the execution of `modal.update()`, be it via setTimeout or a promise, it works.

Title_Description:
InputNumber min/max props incorrect behavior - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/basic-inputnumber-2psbi?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Open the reproduction link
2. It is a standard situation - usage of `<InputNumber />` with `min` prop (my use-case was input for year value with minimum of 1900)
3. Just try to type e.g. 2021 (which is correct input according to `min` prop)
4. Immediately after you type first number `2` it is evaluated as it does not meet the min prop condition and it is automatically changed to value 1900

### What is expected?
I would expect to behave like it was in antd version 4.12.3 - behavior of InputNumber in this version was slightly different - user could type even incorrect number and validation for min/max prop was executed on element blur (not on element value change as it is now)

### What is actually happening?
Typing of value 2021 (which is correct!) for min value 1900 is too complicated for user - without manual delete of input it ends up like "1900021". It causes lots of problems. If this is intended behavior, please, just let me know and I will refactor usage of this min/max pros with validation rules as this behavior makes usage of min/max props nearly impossible.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.15.4 |
| React | 17.0.2 |
| System | Win 10 |
| Browser | Chrome (latest) |

Title_Description:
Message doesn't seem to close - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-forked-feki1?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
Open link, script runs to show the problem.

It seems that the bug is triggered by calling `message.info` again shortly after the `onClose` event.

The message should close after the length of `duration` or it should close after the length of `duration` * `totalClicks`.  I don't know what is expected, but it should be one of these two.  Can somebody clarify?

### What is actually happening?
The message just seems to stay open an unknown amount of time.

```jsx

<Table

    getCheckboxProps:()=>({
    disabled: true,
    })
}}

/>
```

2. Select [select all data] from the drop-down menu, and the unavailable rows will be selected.

Do not select unavailable rows

### What is actually happening?
Selected

Title_Description:
Pagination disabled buttons are not disabled on IOS Safari or mobile like iPad - [X] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/lmfne)

### Steps to reproduce
This can be seen in ant design documentation page for Pagination. Minimal reproduction link taken from there.

* Ok with Linux/Windows any browser
* Ok with Mac Chrome
* Bad with Mac Safari
* Bad with iPad Safari
* Bad with iPad Chrome

### What is expected?

* Pagination button "Previous Page" should be disabled. 
* Text inside "<" should be dimmed. 
* On hover should be "not-allowed" cursor, border color gray and not changing.

### What is actually happening?

* Pagination button "Previous Page" is enabled.
* Text "<" is black. 
* On hover cursor is "pointer", border blue.

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.18.6 |
| React | 16.13.1 |
| System | iOS |
| Browser | Safari |

---
I personally do not have Mac or iPad, but colleagues are complaining and showed it to me. I have reproduced it with epiphany-browser under ubuntu.

Checking with dev-tools I found, that for given functionality is responsible CSS class:

```
.ant-pagination-disabled .ant-pagination-item-link, .ant-pagination-disabled:hover .ant-pagination-item-link, .ant-pagination-disabled:focus-visible .ant-pagination-item-link {
    color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25);
    border-color: #d9d9d9;
    cursor: not-allowed;
}
```

Safari (and iOS mobile Chrome) ignores "ant-pagination-disabled" class and has CSS only for ".ant-pagination-prev button", which makes prev button to look like active.

<!-- 鐠囬攱瀵滈悡褌绗呴崚妤佺壐瀵蹇斿Г閸涘﹪妫舵０姗堢礉閸斺崇箑閹绘劒绶垫径宥囧箛濮濄儵銈忕礉閸氾箑鍨閹鏇㈡︾憴锝呭枀閿涘本鍔呯拫銏″亶閻ㄥ嫭鏁閹镐降-->
#### 闂囧Ч

閹存垿娓剁憰浣风存稉娑撳濯哄楀棗浠涢幖婊呭偍閸旂喕鍏橀妴鍌氱秼閻銊﹀煕鏉堟挸鍙嗛弮璁圭礉闁姘崇箖閻銊﹀煕鏉堟挸鍙嗗Ο锛勭ˇ閺屻儴閿涘苯缍嬮悽銊﹀煕闁澶嬪ㄩ崗铚傜秼閺屾劒绔存い瑙勬傞敍宀勬俺绻冮柅澶嬪ㄩ惃鍕鑲╃翱绾閺屻儴閵
閸︺劎绨跨涵閺屻儴銏℃傞敍灞惧灉娑撳秴绗囬張娑㈡俺绻冪涙冿缚瑕嗙佃勭槷閻ㄥ嫭鏌熷蹇旀偠閿涘矁灞炬Ц闁姘崇箖鐎电懓绨查惃鍑D閺夈儲鐓＄拠閿涘矁绻栭弽閿嬪絹閸楀洦鏅ラ悳鍥ュ倸鎮撻弮鍓佲柤鎼村繑绁︾粙瀣娲块崝鐘崇婚弲鑸
#### 閸欐垹鏁撻梻妫版兼畱閻滄晶鍐╂Ц閿

<!-- 閸斺崇箑閹绘劒绶 -->
- antd 閻楀牊婀: 2.0.1
- 閹垮秳缍旂化鑽ょ埠閸欏﹤鍙鹃悧鍫熸拱: win10
- 濞村繗鍫濇珤閸欏﹤鍙鹃悧鍫熸拱: chrome 閺堥弬鎵澧楅張
#### 閹銊ヤ粵娴滃棔绮堟稊鍫绱

```
in render
var props = {
                combobox: true,
                labelInValue: true,
                value: this.state.value,
                optionFilterProp: "children",
                optionLabelProp: "children" ,
                onChange: this.handleSearchChange
            };
<Select {...props}>
        <Option value=閳1閳>濞村鐦1</Option>
</Select>

--------------------------------------------------

in handleSearchChange
handleSearchChange: function (v) {
               this.setState({value: v})
}

```
#### 閹銊︽埂瀵板懐娈戠紒鎾寸亯閺勯敍

瑜版捇澶嬪ㄦ稉妞よ勬殶閹规稊瀣鎮楅敍瀹籩lect閻滄澘鐤勯惃鍕鍞寸归涜礋label閸.婵″倸缍嬮幋鎴﹀嬪"濞村鐦1"鏉╂瑤绔存い瑙勬傞敍灞界瑖閺堟稖鍏樻径鐔风潔缁琛℃粍绁寸拠1閳ユ繐绱濋懓灞肩瑝閺勯垾1閳
#### 鐎圭偤妾娑撳﹦娈戠紒鎾寸亯閺勯敍

鐎圭偤妾閻滄澘鐤勯惃鍕妞倂alue閻ㄥ嫬
#### 瀵ら缚

閸欐牗绉锋潻娆戝秳绗呴幏澶嬪棔鑵戠仦鏇犮仛value閻ㄥ嫬濮涢懗鏂ょ礉閻銊﹀煕娑撻懜闂囩憰浣藉厴婢剁喓鎮婄憴锝囨畱閹诲繗鍫閿涘矁灞肩瑝閺勬稉宥呭讲閻炲棜袙閻ㄥ墘alue閵

### Steps to reproduce

Title_Description:
Cascader onChange callback passes in [null] as selectedOptions - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-forked-qtk7ok?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce
(1) Click on the cascader input, type in "hang"
(2) Press the down arrow to select the "Zhejiang / Hangzhou / West Lake" option
(3) Press enter.
(4) The console.log statement will print out the passed in value and selectedOptions values. You will see that selectedOptions is an array with one element (null) in it. This is incorrect.

NOTE: this doesn't trigger if you click on an option, only if you use the arrow keys and press enter to select an option.
NOTE: this error is reproducible for me on anything above 4.18.0 閳 downgrading to 4.17.0 fixes this problem.

### What is expected?
selectedOptions passed into the onChange callback should have a list of the options data. If you use your mouse to click on an option, you can see the correct value printed in console.log

### What is actually happening?
selectedOptions is a list with one null element: [null]

| Environment | Info |
|---|---|
| antd | 4.18.9 |
| React | 17.0.2 |
| System | Mac OS 11.6.4 |
| Browser | Chrome v98 |

Title_Description:
Segmented component highlighted option doesn't change on value change ### Reproduction link

[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/antd-reproduction-template-6e93z?file=/index.js)

### Steps to reproduce

Ant version is actually 4.20.0-alpha.1 Which I know isn't the latest stable version but this is still a bug. Not allowed to use CodeSandBox on enterprise network.

const [foo, setFoo] = useState("AND")

<Segmented
  value={foo}
  options={["AND", "OR"]}
  onChange={(e) => setFoo(e.target.value)}
/>
<Segmented
  value={foo}
  options={["AND", "OR"]}
  onChange={(e) => setFoo(e.target.value)}
/>

### What is expected?

The highlighted option should not be dependent on a "click" event on the Segmented component but rather should be dependent on the value passed into the component. I want multiple Segmented to be listening to the same state and the highlighted option should change on all Segmented components when state value changes, not only when the component is clicked. 

### What is actually happening?

Shared state value will be "OR" but one Segmented component will have "AND" highlighted but the other component that was clicked will have "OR" highlighted. 

| Environment | Info |
| --- | --- |
| antd | 4.19.5 |
| React | 18.0.0 |
| System | Windows 10 |
| Browser | Chrome Version 100.0.4896.75 (Official Build) (64-bit) |

---
This functionality works as expected with the Switch component.

Title_Description:
form inline style break when input set with addonBefore, addonAfter prop <!-- Issue Template -->

<!-- 鐠囬攱瀵滈悡褌绗呴崚妤佺壐瀵蹇斿Г閸涘﹪妫舵０姗堢礉閸斺崇箑閹绘劒绶垫径宥囧箛濮濄儵銈忕礉閸氾箑鍨閹鏇㈡︾憴锝呭枀閿涘本鍔呯拫銏″亶閻ㄥ嫭鏁閹镐降-->

when adding inline form, Input button will break when setting addonBefore and addonAfter props.
#### 閸欐垹鏁撻梻妫版兼畱閻滄晶鍐╂Ц閿

<!-- 閸斺崇箑閹绘劒绶 -->
- antd 閻楀牊婀: 2.1.0
- 閹垮秳缍旂化鑽ょ埠閸欏﹤鍙鹃悧鍫熸拱: mac Sierra
- 濞村繗鍫濇珤閸欏﹤鍙鹃悧鍫熸拱: chrome Version 53.0.2785.143
#### 閹銊ヤ粵娴滃棔绮堟稊鍫绱

<!-- 婵″偊绱板鏇炲弳 antd 娴 Button -->

``` js
<Form inline>
  <FormItem
    label="setting"
  >
    <Input
        style={{width: '200px'}}
        addonBefore="http://" // <------------------------- this prop will make inline form break. NOTE: using addonAfter also break inline style.
        placeholder="enter text"/>
  </FormItem>
  <FormItem>
    <Input
        style={{width: '200px'}}
        placeholder="enter text 2"/>
  </FormItem>
</Form>
```

inline style should work.

Title_Description:
Cascader bug I ran into a bug with the cascader where it highlights multiple parent items when a child item is selected. This seems to stem from the case where a child `value` is equal to a parent `value` in the cascader.

Note I managed to get around this by appending the entity I was working with, so if the first column was ItemType and the second column was Item I would make the values for the ItemType column itemType:id and item:id. This would ensure that that nothing could match incorrectly.

This is a bit tricky to explain so I included an example - http://codepen.io/anon/pen/vXVgPm?editors=001

If you select `1 > 2` you will see what I mean.
Creator: ryannealmes

### Steps to reproduce

- Use the Popover component (wrap a button with popover)
- Set the popover's color property to some value. For example color="#a0f0f0"

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92163428/175529456-5f243281-eae1-466b-8742-e59edde077fe.png)


### What is expected?

The popover should use the value from the color prop. The color should be used also on for the arrow (so the same behavior as in previous Ant Design versions) 

### What is actually happening?

The popover arrow's color is still white and you can not change it by setting the color prop.

Title_Description:
Anchor: scrollTo helper truncating the first char, assumes ID. Error prone and pointless. There are several things wrong with the "href" in an `<Anchor.Link>`.

1. It isn't an href, but a selector.
2. Using a selector is very limiting. I propose allowing it to take a `DOMNode`, that way you could easily pass in the results from a `document.querySelector` if you wanted to get the same result. Calling it `target` would make sense since it's the target of the AnchorLink.
3. This is especially bad, because it's both assuming it's an ID selector, and for some reason truncating it: `const targetElement = document.getElementById(href.substring(1));`
4. If your href were '.foobar', but there was a '#foobar' on the page, that's what it would match. This would be a massive pain to debug.
5. It's a pointless waste and added confusion to pass this to a `getElementById`, when you could simply `querySelector`.

https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/blob/ee2654dbe1a6532f60b146bf6f9f3346299553c8/components/anchor/anchorHelper.tsx#L48

While there are many problems with this approach, taking a 'target' property as a DOMNode solves them all.
Creator: jkoudys

Title_Description:
Affix not recalculate width after resize  - antd version: 2.6.3
- OS and its version: Mac os Sierra
- Browser and its version: Chrome 55

#### What did you do? Please provide steps to re-produce your problem.

Using Affix with Atepper

#### What do you expected?

Affix should resizes when window resizes

#### What happen?

Affix's width is computed with the current width of the screen, however if screen resizes, the width is not being computed again, that will be fix until affix disappear (when you scroll to top)

#### Re-producible online demo

http://codepen.io/kossel/pen/vggxwB?editors=0010

1. Scroll until the stepper sticks at the top
2. Resize the screen
3. The width of the affix does not change.
Creator: kossel

#### What did you do? Please provide steps to re-produce your problem.

antd 2.6.3 閻楀牊婀伴敍

api 閺傚洦銆傛稉濠傚晸閻 showHeader 閻ㄥ嫰绮鐠併倕鍏兼Ц true閿

閻㈢喐鍨氶惃 table 娑撻搹鐣屽姧妞ょ敻娼伴弰鍓с仛娴滃棜銆冩径杈剧礉娴ｅ棙妲 table 閺堥煬閸楁潙姘绨℃稉娑 閳 ant-table-without-column-header 閳 鏉╂瑤閲滅猾浼欑礉

Title_Description: Badge component does not display correctly when browser zoom above 100% #### Environment - antd version: 2.6.4 - OS and its version: macOS Sierra v10.12.3 - Browser and its version: Google Chrome v55.0.2883.95 #### What did you do? Please provide steps to re-produce your problem. Increased browser zoom above 100% and rendered Badge component in ant.design documentation (https://ant.design/components/badge/#components-badge-demo-no-wrapper). #### What did you expect? Badge component should display correctly at all zoom levels - this is important for accessibility. #### What happened? Badge component is not displayed correctly when browser zoom above 100%. #### Re-producible online demo Visit https://ant.design/components/badge/#components-badge-demo-no-wrapper and increase browser zoom above 100%. I found this related issue https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/4290 but could not figure out if it was solved (Google Translate struggles with Chinese).

Title_Description:
validateFieldsAndScroll does not work with nested getFieldDecorator - antd version: 2.7.1
- OS and its version: Mac Os Sierra
- Browser and its version: chrome 56

#### What did you do? Please provide steps to re-produce your problem.

using `validateFieldsAndScroll` with nested getFieldDecorator.id. eg
```
{getFieldDecorator('user.firstName', {
              })(
                <Input
                  type="textarea"
                  rows={4}
                />)}
```
#### What do you expected?

validate and scroll to the `user.firstName` input

#### What happen?

does not scroll

#### Re-producible online demo

http://codepen.io/kossel/pen/xqpbww?editors=0010

Additional information:

I debugged it, looks like it's problem of rc-form:
cause:
https://github.com/react-component/form/blob/master/src/createDOMForm.js#L63
when use id with "." (dot)  such as "user.firstname" can not find the instance because `user.firstName != 'user.firstName'`

root cause:
https://github.com/react-component/form/blob/master/src/createBaseForm.js#L307
lodash set will make the fieldKey (id) `user.firstName` into  `user={firstName: 'value'}`

so I changed it to 
` alreadyErrors[name] = { errors: field.errors } ;`
works so far, **but I not sure if this will create any side effect**, or there is a better solution.
If needed I can create a PR but I would like to know your opinion
Creator: kossel

Title_Description:
AutoComplete: Async loading of options fail first render. ### Version
2.8.3

### Environment
Any

### Reproduction link
[http://codepen.io/JesperWe/pen/XMOzqP](http://codepen.io/JesperWe/pen/XMOzqP)

(Type 'res' slooowly in the input field. Notice first menu item does not appear until second character typed.)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Start with `dataSource = []`
2. When user enters one character search text, do async request for results to server. (Simulated by `setTimeout` in the codepen)
3. When result arrives, update AutoComplete dataSource.


### What is expected?
Menu to pop up with option from *first* async server result.

### What is actually happening?
Menu is *not* appearing until dataSource has been updated 2 times (after request made on second character returns).
After second update each new async result updates the menu as expected.

---
This issue is only present when using async loading and on the **first** update of dataSource from `[]` to `[...some options...]`.

<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Creator: JesperWe

Title_Description:
Select mode=tags with tokenSeparators crashes on 2 consecutive token keypresses ### Version
2.9.1

### Environment
osx 10.11.6, Chrome 57.0.2987.133

### Reproduction link
[http://codepen.io/anon/pen/rmeeab?editors=001](http://codepen.io/anon/pen/rmeeab?editors=001)

### Steps to reproduce
`Select` in `mode="tags"` with `tokenSeparators={[" "]}` set ("space" for example). Pressing the token key (space) twice in a row throws an exception: `"Uncaught Error: must set key for <rc-animate> children"`, and breaks the component.

### What is expected?
Ignore the token keypresses if the current tag value is empty.

### What is actually happening?
An exception is being thrown and the component stops working.

---
Tested this in the demo page: https://ant.design/components/select/#components-select-demo-automatic-tokenization and it displays the same behaviour. The token defined there is ",". Pressing "," twice crashes the component.

Title_Description:
getFieldDecorator with nested field format is not allowing arrays of objects to setFieldsValue ### Version
2.9.1

### Environment
Mac OS, chrome, react ^15.4.2

### Reproduction link
[http://codepen.io/ffab00/pen/wdGrVQ](http://codepen.io/ffab00/pen/wdGrVQ)

### Steps to reproduce
When adding a getFieldDecorator for a field inside array of objects it prevents setFieldsValue from saving.
This makes it hard to create repeatable sections.

Open codepen link, 
Click add button multiple times, 
it will not add more section, 
Remove line 36 `{form.getFieldDecorator('pumps[' + index + '].make', { })(<Input />)} `  
And sections will be added



### What is expected?
Expected to be able to add multiple sections of fields in array field.

### What is actually happening?
New objects are not pushed to array by `setFieldsValue` when `getFieldDecorator` for nested field is present in `render`

---
I was trying to create a form with repeatable groups of fields (array of objects).
Would appreciate working examples.
Followed this example initially https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/blob/master/components/form/demo/dynamic-form-item.md  but extended it to allow multiple fields in each array/object. 

May be related to https://github.com/react-component/form/pull/48

Title_Description:
AutoComplete: Re-renders cause the dropdown popup to appear by itself. ### Version
2.11.1

### Environment
macOS Sierra, Chrome 58.0.3029.

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/anon/pen/MovVQq](https://codepen.io/anon/pen/MovVQq)

### Steps to reproduce
Create an AutoComplete component whose value is changed as a result of an "onSelect" callback. 
Try it again with a longer callback.

### What is expected?
The AutoComplete value will be immediately set. After the onSelect callback and the delay, nothing will change even if there are re-renders.

### What is actually happening?
The AutoComplete component will re-show its popup.

---
Please look at the reproduction to make things more clear.
I've included a workaround that solves the problem. 
The workaround proves that if the component does not re-render, the popup does not reappear.

-> Build a simple Tree, with some nested TreeNodes
-> Mark one of the child `TreeNodes` with `disabled` and `disableCheckBox`

Please let me know if you need help with any of these TreeView related issues. I'm trying to use it for our application and would be glad to help you guys with a PR.

Title_Description:
Icon button with loading state still displays incorrectly. ### Version
2.13.2

### Environment
Chrome Version 60.0.3112.113 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/gRoberts84/pen/aLmWmr?editors=0010](https://codepen.io/gRoberts84/pen/aLmWmr?editors=0010)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add Icon Button with loading enabled (`<Button icon="pause" loading={true} />`) 
2. Add a Button Group with one or more Icon Buttons with loading enabled.

### What is expected?
Loading icon should replace the existing icon without changing the dimensions of the underlying button.

### What is actually happening?
If the Button is outside of a Button Group, or the first in a Button Group, too much left padding is applied.
If the Button is within a Button Group but not the first button, not enough left padding is applied.

Related to my previously reported issue - #6822

Title_Description:
Editable table example doesn't work for multi-page table ### Version
2.13.7

### Environment
Mac OS X, Chrome, React latest

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/Llevar/pen/zPOOdB](https://codepen.io/Llevar/pen/zPOOdB)

### Steps to reproduce
The editable rows example on https://ant.design/components/table/ works well enough on tables that have a single page, but breaks down for tables with more than one page. This is because the code uses an index variable to update state. This index is relative to the current page that you are on, whereas the state is not aware of pages and thus the wrong records end up being updated.

See codepen, but basically add more records to force a second page to be created. Try to edit a row on the second page. Without clicking on Save or Cancel navigate to the first page and observe that the corresponding row on the first page is also expanded. Inspect the state to see that the wrong record has been marked as editable. 

### What is expected?
It is expected that this code works on tables with multiple pages.

### What is actually happening?
The table does not work on tables with multiple pages. The right row appears to be editable, but also the same row on the first page is editable, and the state has the incorrect row marked as editable.

Title_Description:
Issue with decimal points ### Version
2.13.10

### Environment
Google Chrome Version 61.0

### Reproduction link
[https://www.webpackbin.com/bins/-KzNG_w_2KENlQNzvdws](https://www.webpackbin.com/bins/-KzNG_w_2KENlQNzvdws)

### Steps to reproduce
The first component is `<input type="number">`, this has incorrect validation for decimal points:

1. add the value 1.2., see that the value displayed is 1.2., check that the value in state is 1.2 and add another . to the input value and see that the value has been cleared

2. repeat the above step, adding 1.2. into the InputNumber, check that the InputNumber has no validations for that.

I need to use the first one because I need access to the suffix prop which is available on the Input component.

### What is expected?
Either the value is always passed to the onChange handler as a string without any validation if using the Input (same as what you do for the InputNumber), if not the Input is validated ensure that 1.2. is handled in a consistent way and the value remains 1.2 as displayed to the user and in the onChange.

Or provide suffix and prefix props for the InputNumber and add a prop for disabling the up-down buttons.

### What is actually happening?
As explained in steps to reproduce, `Input with type="number"` validates the numerical value incorrectly and InputNumber does not provide a suffix or a prefix but does not validate the value at all.

Title_Description:
Table's pagination style is covered in antd@3.0.0-rc.1 by babel-plugin-import ### Version
3.0.0-rc.1

### Environment
ubuntu chrome

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/buxuku/antd-pagination](https://github.com/buxuku/antd-pagination)

### Steps to reproduce
antd@3.0-rc1
If I use 
```
import 'antd/dist/antd.css';
```
the table's pagination style is ok.

but if I use `babel-plugin-import` in my project, Table's pagination style is covered.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7866330/33012882-262fe522-ce1d-11e7-99c0-2224c4d67274.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7866330/33012935-456dc60c-ce1d-11e7-9994-3d277fc73f45.png)

No matter use:
```
"import", { "libraryName": "antd","style":"css"}
```
Or
```
"import", { "libraryName": "antd","style":true}
```



### What is expected?
Table's pagination style is ok.

### What is actually happening?
Table's pagination style is covered.

Invalid width property on notification message ### Version
3.0.0

### Environment
all

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/blob/master/components/notification/style/index.less#L47](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/blob/master/components/notification/style/index.less#L47)

### Steps to reproduce
We are using postcss and also ant design. when upgrade to 3.0.0 antd.css produce invalid css causing postcss loader to crash.
The issue is with this line. https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/blob/master/components/notification/style/index.less#L47
compiled css looks like 
`width: calc(384px - 16px 24px * 2 - 24px - 48px - 100%);`

specifically this is not valid ` 16px 24px`

example error message is
```
ERROR in ./node_modules/css-loader?{"sourceMap":true,"minimize":false}!./node_modules/postcss-loader/lib?{"config":{"path":"./tools/postcss.config.js"}}!./node_modules/antd/dist/antd.css
Module build failed: Parse error on line 1:
384px - 16px 24px * 2 - 24px - 48
-------------^
Expecting 'EOF', 'ADD', 'SUB', 'MUL', 'DIV', 'RPAREN', got 'LENGTH'
```

### What is expected?
The width property is valid

### What is actually happening?
The width property is not valid 

---
Ran into this bug while upgrading to latest ant version (3.0.0)

Creator: vthinkxie

Title_Description:
When the <Table> component sets the showQuickJumper and showSizeChanger parameters for pagination, the margin property between the sizeChanger <Select> and the jump to the page is 0. ### What problem does this feature solve?
When the **<Table> component** sets the **showQuickJumper** and **showSizeChanger** parameters for pagination, the **margin** property between the **sizeChanger <Select> component** and the **jump to the page component** is 0.   
`.ant-select: margin 0` covered `.ant-pagination-options-size-changer: margin-right: 8px`. I don't think it looks very beautiful.

### What does the proposed API look like?
When the **<Table> component** sets the **showQuickJumper** and **showSizeChanger** parameters for pagination, the interval between **sizeChanger <Select> component** and **jump to the page component** will be more beautiful.

TreeSelect: Clicks "X" to remove selected item in the input box of filter, the returned information is not complete compared to unselect a selected item in the dropdown menu. ### Version
2.13.8

### Environment
Windows 10, Google Chrome Version 63.0.3239.84 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/0m46kqvvml](https://codesandbox.io/s/0m46kqvvml)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Checked both the Node1 and Node2.
2. Click 'X' to remove Node2 from the input box.

### What is expected?
Console log the props of each selected node. Both Click 'X' to remove Node2 and unselect Node2 from drop-down menu should return value list below.
Object {value: "0-0", title: "Node1", disabled: false, selectable: true, foo: 1, children: Array[1]}

### What is actually happening?
Unselect from drop-down menu is correct. But click 'X' to remove Node2 will return incomplete info for Node1. It returns
Object {title: "Node1", label: "Node1", value: "0-0", children: Array[1]}
The "foo" and some other properties are missed.

---
When user clicks "X" to remove selected item in the input box of filter, the returned information is not complete compared to unselect a selected item in the dropdown menu. Which means, I cannot get the property ("foo") of the selected item when user removing the item by click "X"

Title_Description:
Add a prop to force Layout to know it has a Sider (with SSR) ### What problem does this feature solve?

This will prevent the layout from flickering when loading after server-side rendering (`SSR`).
  
Example:  

```jsx
<Layout>
  <Layout.Sider />
  <Layout>
    <Layout.Content />
  </Layout>
</Layout>
```

As it is, `Layout.Content` appears below `Layout.Sider` during an instant, and only after the JS load is done it sets in the right position.

### What does the proposed API look like?

```jsx
<Layout hasSider />
<Layout hasSider={true} />
```
or 
```jsx
<Layout withSider />
<Layout withSider={true} />
```

When you remove a "parent" TreeNode from "expandedKeys", with other TreeNodes nested inside of it expanded,  it should collapse.

Title_Description:
InputNumber: Issue with entering negative numbers when value prop is bound ### Version
3.2.2

### Environment
windows 7, chrome 57.0.2987.133 64.0.3282.167

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/4xj4jpl787](https://codesandbox.io/s/4xj4jpl787)

### Steps to reproduce
Try and type '-0.04' into the inputnumber labelled as bound & broken.

### What is expected?
It should retain the value of '-0' as you type it in, allowing the user to type in '-0.04'.

This only occurs when the value property of the inputnumber is defined. It works fine in the other unbound InputNumber in the reproduction.

Title_Description:
InputNumber buttons not managing onBlur/focus correctly - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues) of this repository and believe that this is not a duplicate.

### Version
3.3.2 to 3.4.0

### Environment
Windows 7/Mac OSX 10.12.3/Ubuntu 17.10   Chrome 65.0.3325.181   React 16.3.1

### Reproduction link
[![Edit on CodeSandbox](https://codesandbox.io/static/img/play-codesandbox.svg)](https://codesandbox.io/s/q7r4ylojl6)

### Steps to reproduce
* Try increasing/decreasing a number by clicking the buttons for an InputNumber.
The whole field is focused.
* Try clicking outside, in another field or on another component.

### What is expected?
The InputNumber field should no longer be focused/highlighted and an onBlur-event should fire. Alternatively the onBlur-event should fire immediately when releasing the button.

### What is actually happening?
Nothing. The only way to remove focus and trigger onBlur is to click inside the same field as the buttons, and then clicking outside.

Here's an example of how it used to work, using 3.3.1: [https://codesandbox.io/s/849ro0pwoj](https://codesandbox.io/s/849ro0pwoj)

---
This bug seems to have been introduced with version 3.3.2, since the behavior is not present in version 3.3.1.


<!-- generated by ant-design-issue-helper. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Creator: duniul
